http://politics.gather.com/viewArticle.action?articleId=281474979763337
 
 
No matter what the Speaker suggests, the answer over the past few weeks has not changed, "no" is the only word Americans keep hearing from their elected officials. One political ad that stands out is current 2012 Presidential candidate and Tea Party member Michele Bachmann and her stance of, "I will not vote to increase the debt ceiling. It goes completely to commonsense and how I grew up in Iowa. So here I am in Congress watching these people borrow more money that we don't have so that my children can be further indebted. "

 
 I really hate that free speech allows lies that can hurt our country. I don't understand how lack of education can be so accepted.

post_info.post_title: Is the Tea Party Ruining America?

http://politics.gather.com/viewArticle.action?articleId=281474979763337
 
 
 
 I really hate that free speech allows lies that can hurt our country. I don't understand how lack of education can be so accepted.

 I applaud anyone who is unwilling to buy the lies about the necessity of stealing even more wealth.
 
 The article cites unfaltering commitment to one's promises like it's a fault.

The fact that we are here today to debate raising America's debt limit is a sign of leadership failure. It is a sign that the U.S. Government can't pay its own bills.
 
 Instead of reducing the deficit, as some people claimed, the fiscal policies of this administration and its allies in Congress will add more than $600 million in debt for each of the next five years.
 
 Increasing America's debt weakens us domestically and internationally. Leadership means that 'the buck stops here.' Instead, Washington is shifting the burden of bad choices today onto the backs of our children and grandchildren. America has a debt problem and a failure of leadership. Americans deserve better.
 
 I am of course quoting Barack Obama - Senator

The Tea party are a bunch of selfish bastards that, imho, should be hug out to dry, or worse.
 We wouldn't need a raise in the debt limit if we had stayed out of Iraq. It seems that the same people who cried the loudest for war, and the most fanatical Bush supporters are now crying foul at having to pay for his and the republican parties 6 trillion addition to the debt.
 
 There is a simple answer to all of this but congress won't do it. 
 
 1. Raise the top income tax rates to 50%
 
 2 eliminate all deductions across the board for all tax brackets. This would include mortgage, EITC, and all children.
 
 3 raise tariffs 100 or 200% on any American company importing goods to the US from foreign countries. Yes walmart would not be able to sell made in china products without paying a hefty tariff. Make it more expensive to import then to produce it here. 
 
 4 Raise the social security retirement, and medicare eligibility age to 70. I know many many may able bodied 68 year olds.
 
 5 End all subsidies to agriculture, and the oil companies.
 
 6 Add a profits tax on corporations. If profits exceed 60% of a corporations income they would be subject to this tax, unless they reinvest those profits back into the US economy. 
 
 7 Cut defense spending by 50%
 
 This way all Americans sacrifice

The Tea Party is simply emblematic of the sea change that has begun in the last couple of years in terms of making Washington do better at financial responsibility. If it weren't for the tea party, we wouldn't even be having the debate about more and more debt. 
 Its a sea change that the current administration doesn't seem to understand is going on.

The Tea party are a bunch of selfish bastards that, imho, should be hug out to dry, or worse.

 I'm sure they'd love a hug :p
 
 
We wouldn't need a raise in the debt limit if we had stayed out of Iraq. It seems that the same people who cried the loudest for war, and the most fanatical Bush supporters are now crying foul at having to pay for his and the republican parties 6 trillion addition to the debt.

 Support that.
 
 How much was the war of our budget?
 
 
There is a simple answer to all of this but congress won't do it. 

 You bet there is.
 
 
1. Raise the top income tax rates to 50%

 Remove all taxes.
 
 
2 eliminate all deductions across the board for all tax brackets. This would include mortgage, EITC, and all children.

 No more deductions, nothing to deduct.
 
 
3 raise tariffs 100 or 200% on any American company importing goods to the US from foreign countries. Yes walmart would not be able to sell made in china products without paying a hefty tariff. Make it more expensive to import then to produce it here. 

 Cut tarrifs to zero.
 
 
4 Raise the social security retirement, and medicare eligibility age to 70. I know many many may able bodied 68 year olds.

 Remove social security.
 
 
5 End all subsidies to agriculture, and the oil companies.

 Very good, but you forgot 'green' energy.
 
 
6 Add a profits tax on corporations. If profits exceed 60% of a corporations income they would be subject to this tax, unless they reinvest those profits back into the US economy. 

 Don't even think about taxes unless you want to be the star of a criminal intent episode.
 
 
7 Cut defense spending by 50%

 Let people decide what to spend on everything.
 
 8. Nullify the public debt, there was never any authority given to borrow on the asset of the general population; and if there was it would fall to those who voted for left wing candidates, which I don't think your on board for.
 
 
This way all Americans sacrifice

 Sacrifice your own life, some of us value it.
